title: Gold
content:
The RuneScape Wiki also has an article on: rsw:Gold

Gold may refer to:

NPCs[edit | edit source]

  • Golden warbler, a Hunter creature.

Items[edit | edit source]

  • Coins
  • Decorative armour:
    • Gold decorative helm
    • Gold decorative body
    • Gold decorative legs
    • Gold decorative skirt
    • Gold decorative sword
    • Gold decorative shield
  • Jewellery:
    • Gold ring
    • Gold necklace
    • Gold bracelet
    • Gold amulet, and its unstrung version.
  • Legends' Quest items:
    • Blessed gold bowl
    • Gold bowl
    • Golden bowl
  • Priest in Peril items:
    • Golden candle
    • Golden feather
    • Golden hammer
    • Golden key
    • Golden needle
    • Golden pot
    • Golden tinderbox
  • Treasure Trails rewards:
    • Gilded equipment
    • Gold-trimmed armour
    • Golden apron
    • Golden chef's hat
    • Gold elegant shirt
    • Gold elegant legs
    • Gold elegant blouse
    • Gold elegant skirt
    • Gold headband
  • Gold ore, and its 'perfect' version.
  • Gold bar and its 'perfect' version.
  • Gold dust
  • Gold fragment, an item from the 2017 Easter event.
  • Gold helmet, an item used in the Between a Rock... quest.
  • Gold leaf, an item used in Construction.
  • Gold nuggets, obtained in the Motherlode Mine.
  • Gold paint
  • Gold satchel, dropped by jubsters.
  • Golden goblin, an item used in the Grim Tales quest.
  • Golden tench, a fun weapon
  • Goldsmith gauntlets, an item obtained from the Family Crest quest.
  • Magic gold feather, an item used in the Holy Grail quest.
  • Nuggets, an item found at the Digsite.
  • Toban's gold, an item used in the Watchtower quest.

Other[edit | edit source]

  • Gold candlesticks, a piece of furniture constructed in a Chapel.
  • Gold rock, mined for gold ore.
  • Goldie, an NPC from the 2017 Easter event
  • Golden Apple Tree, a tree used in The Fremennik Trials quest.
  • Grum's Gold Exchange, a shop in Port Sarim.
  • Gold sink, an economic term.
 This page is used to distinguish between articles with similar names.
If an internal link led you to this disambiguation page, you may wish to change the link to point directly to the intended article.
